body.name: Loving a Healer in Disguise: A Historical Western Romance Novel
body.description: As the only child of a strict, widowed father, Elaine Jenkins’ life is far from the romantic dreams she secretly cherishes. Her bold defiance of societal norms leads her to create a disguise as 'Eli Bower,' assuming her uncle's veterinary practice in Texas. Concealed beneath short hair, a fabricated mustache, and boyish attire, she vows to keep her true identity hidden, even from her father. Yet, her heart longs for a connection that transcends her disguise...Will her secret push away the very affection she desires?Warren Findlay Grant, equally entangled in his own web of secrets, dreams of a life far from his destined path as a rancher. Yearning to pursue his passion for writing, he leaves the family ranch, only to find his fate intertwined with Elaine's in an unexpected storm. Rescued and cared for by 'Eli,' an enigmatic connection forms between them. Unbeknownst to Fin, 'Eli' could be the woman who could fulfill the unspoken desires of his heart…Can Fin combine his writerly aspirations with the realities of ranch life, or will his secrets unravel, jeopardizing both his and Elaine's futures?When a vicious disease imperils the Red Oak cattle, and a revelation about Elaine's double life strains her relationship with her father, the stakes of their concealed affections escalate. In this entanglement of love and deception, will Elaine and Fin seize the chance for a love as wild and free as the land they cherish, or will the weight of their secrets doom their chances for happiness?"Loving a Healer in Disguise" is a historical romance novel of approximately 80,000 words. No cheating, no cliffhangers, and a guaranteed happily ever after. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The truth will always come out
reviews.reviewText: Elaine loves animals and wants to help them but feels her father will not let her down what she wants to do so she pretends to be a man.Warren wants to be a writer and his father wants him to take over the ranch so he runs away. They seem to find each other but just can't bring themselves to tell the other the truth. Can they ever?I throughly enjoyed this well written book from the beginning and hated to send it end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Some Things Aren't what They Seem To Be
reviews.reviewText: Parenting is never easy. The possibility of error is always present and understanding communication is a challenge at all ages.Lainey's deceased mother and lack of siblings gave her a lonely life. Fin' s need to write and find some quiet time to do so, gave him a skewed view of his blessings. Guess how it all worked out?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars ACCIDENT WITH LASTING POSTIVE OUTCOME
reviews.reviewText: Well written, historical correct story. Warren ‘Fin’ comfortable with his father’s ranch, but wants to become writer, not a rancher, thinking he needs to do more exploring in order to be successful writer. Cedar Ridge is 20 miles from Red Oak ranch were Warren lived, but he headed out on his horse, Rocker to start his writer’s journey.Meanwhile, Cedar Ridge is where Elaine lives with her blacksmith father, but her interest is in veterinary medicine like her uncle, but her father is set against it. To avoid confrontation with her father, she takes up in covert persona to gain experience anyway.Warren, along with his horse fell into a ravine that both needed medical care from that accident. Guess who helps horse and ‘Fin’? The happenstance is the accident with lasting positive outcome for Warren and Elaine. Story is packed with lots interesting events to hold a reader’s interest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The story of Elaine and Warren creates a hope for women trying to succeed in a mans world. Mia Dunham excellently pulled it off. A great story of a devotion to animals. A must read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Good writing, captivating storyline, interesting characters, some suspense and a HEA make for a good book! It highlighted the fact that the truth will come out eventually. Couldn’t put it down!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tell me no secrets and I'll tell you no lies...
reviews.reviewText: This book is such a hoot! Loved it! Fin is a rancher Wanna-Be writer and Elaine wants to be a vet, so she dons a disguise to look like a male in order to succeed. What happens when two liars meet? Thunder and lightning! This is a great story, very full of action, drama, excitement, and love.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hiding in plain sight
reviews.reviewText: This was a story that had two stories in it. A girl named Elaine that wanted to be a veterinarian and a boy named Fin that wanted to be a writer. Both did things to get away from their real lives to do the things that made them happy. They just also managed to be made happy by each other. Great story!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Lies cause a lot of pain and are usually found out
reviews.reviewText: This was an enjoyable book but seemed more like a fairytale at times. I have trouble accepting the fact Elaine/Eli could get away with a disguise in the town where she was raised. Fin's mother spotted the lie as soon as she saw Elaine/Eli. It is a well written book with a new twist on life. This is a story of two people telling lies and wanting to fulfill their life's dreams. Fin's parents don't understand why he wants to pursue writing instead of taking over the large ranch. Elaine's father is very strict and doesn't even know she wants to be an animal healer. Can these young people finally get the happiness and freedom they so crave?
Elaine wants to be a veterinarian, and disguises herself as a man to do so,fin wants to be a writer and leaves home to accomplish it as his father thinksHe should be a rancher

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 28, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Well written, well researched, believable characters. I found a bit long but overall, a really good story. I love all of Mia's books that I have read so far.
